intro: Boechera calderi, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of California and Nevada. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This perennial herb typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high elevations. Its small, white flowers bloom in early spring, and it produces rounded, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Boechera calderi is adapted to cold, arid environments and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats.
